snippet: The main floor of the National September 11 Memorial Museum, still under construction nearly 70 feet below the memorial plaza at the World Trade Center, filled with at least seven feet of water.
abstract: National September 11 Memorial Museum officials report that the structure, still under construction, was flooded with at least seven feet of water during Hurricane Sandy; flood waters nearly immersed two fire trucks that had already been placed in the museum and surrounded the symbolic last column taken from the twin towers.
lead_paragraph: The main floor of the National September 11 Memorial Museum, still under construction nearly 70 feet below the memorial plaza at the World Trade Center, filled with at least seven feet of water.

headline.main: Floodwater Pours Into 9/11 Museum, Hampering Further Work on the Site
headline.print_headline: Floodwater Pours Into 9/11 Museum, Hampering Further Work on the Site
